channel.title: [Command Release] Tell

item.title: [Command Release] Tell
item.dc:creator: @Krypton1 Krypton
item.description:
@Krypton1 wrote:

[quote=“RSCShadow, post:12, topic:333928”][quote author=Krypton link=topic=430325.msg3159975#msg3159975 date=1269448555]
I like that you are trying to release things to the community but this command has many things that haven’t been thought out. First off its too similar to the friends list messaging. Second off the friends list has a good idea to it, the players can private communicate with who they wish. This command has no restrictions on it, what is stopping people from annoying others? I just think this is a bit pointless no offense.
[/quote]I already improved it a lot on my server (adding blocks and toggles etc.).[/quote]
Then it basically replicates the friends list as a command doesn’t it?

Read full topic

This command has no restrictions on it, what is stopping people from annoying others? item.title: [Command Release] Tell
item.dc:creator: @yong_min yong min
item.description:
@yong_min wrote:

As Luke said, it’s not even sending a private message, but displaying a message to look like a private message. Are you aware of:

getActionSender().sendPrivateMessage

item.title: [Command Release] Tell
item.dc:creator: @RSCShadow RSCShadow
item.description:
@RSCShadow wrote:

Well if you have Noobscape 3, you can change it to say. In Noobscape 2, say was saved under quests so I put it there. Doesn’t really matter anyway change it to whatever you want.

item.title: [Command Release] Tell
item.dc:creator: @RSCShadow RSCShadow
item.description:
@RSCShadow wrote:

if(cmd.equals("tell")) { long PlayerHash = DataConversions.usernameToHash(args[0]); Player p = world.getPlayer(PlayerHash); if(p != null) { String newStr = ""; for(int i = 1; i < args.length; i++) { newStr = (new StringBuilder()).append(newStr).append(args[i]).append(" ").toString(); } p.getActionSender().sendMessage("@pri@@cya@" + player.getUsername() + " sends you:@whi@ " + newStr); player.getActionSender().sendMessage("@pri@@cya@You send " + p.getUsername() + ":@whi@ " + newStr); }else{ player.getActionSender().sendMessage("Invalid player. Please make sure they are online!"); } }
I’m still working on a timer but it basically sends the player a private message without adding them to your friends list. Feel free to add your improvments (by the way, I added a toggle to turn this on/off for myself :P)

Read full topic
